abstract: After not reaching anyone in the refund department at American Airlines, a reader asks the Haggler for help.
snippet: After not reaching anyone in the refund department at American Airlines, a reader asks the Haggler for help.
lead_paragraph: WITH this episode, the Haggler celebrates the first anniversary of this column. After 12 months of cranky but polite consumer intercessions, what we have learned? A lot. Don’t buy anything from a company you don’t know until you Google its name along with the word “complaints.” If you must send a glass induction cooktop via FedEx, use plenty of packing peanuts. And, most important: Never make a collect phone call from Kennedy Airport. It’s way too expensive.

headline.main: The Refund That Circled Before Landing
